name: Nigeria
description: Nigeria has abundant petroleum and natural gas reserves. Other key resources include tin, limestone, iron ore, and coal. It remains one of Africa’s largest oil producers.

name: Ghana
description: Ghana is a leading producer of gold, cocoa, and bauxite. The country also has significant manganese and oil resources.

name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
description: The DRC holds vast deposits of copper, cobalt, diamonds, and coltan, making it a key supplier for global technology industries.

name: South Africa
description: South Africa is rich in minerals such as gold, platinum, chromium, and coal, and has a strong industrial base.

name: Angola
description: Angola’s economy is heavily dependent on oil production, with diamonds also playing a significant role in exports.

name: Egypt
description: Egypt possesses petroleum, natural gas, phosphates, and limestone, supporting both its industrial and export sectors.

name: Algeria
description: Algeria is one of Africa’s largest natural gas exporters and also has major oil and phosphate reserves.

name: Kenya
description: Kenya’s natural resources include soda ash, limestone, gemstones, and rare earth elements. It is also known for geothermal energy.

name: Ethiopia
description: Ethiopia’s key resources include gold, tantalum, potash, and natural gas. Agriculture and minerals drive its exports.

name: Morocco
description: Morocco holds over 70% of the world’s phosphate reserves and also produces lead, zinc, and silver.
